title: Safe Animal Food Preparation in Fallout Areas
brief: How to safely prepare animal meat for consumption in radioactive environments.
steps: Step 1: Never eat animals that appear sick - they may have bacterial infections from radiation poisoning.
Step 2: Carefully skin all animals to prevent radioactive particles from entering the body.
Step 3: Cut meat away from bones, leaving at least 3mm thickness of meat on the bone.
Step 4: Discard all internal organs (heart, liver, kidneys) as they concentrate radioactivity.
Step 5: Cut meat into pieces less than 13mm thick before cooking.
Step 6: Cook all meat until very well done to ensure safety.
Step 7: Eggs are safe to eat even if laid during fallout period.
Step 8: Avoid all milk from fallout area animals.
warnings: Animal skeletons contain over 90% of radioactivity - stay away from bones and joints.
Fish and aquatic animals have much greater contamination - use only in extreme emergency.
Contaminated meat can cause severe illness or death even if thoroughly cooked.
